title: Sam Willoughby continuing to improve, dad says - Yahoo7
text:
Share Sam Willoughby continuing to improve, dad says - Yahoo7 World BMX champion Sam Willoughby can now hold himself up on a stationary bike and pedal with help as he works to recover from a horrific spinal injury, his father says. Close Aussie BMX rider may never walk again UP NEXT VIDEO Aussie BMX rider may never walk again. Source: 7News Aussie BMX rider may never walk again 
Colin Willoughby says his son's rehabilitation following the injury during a training ride in September is going well and he is "continuing to improve". 
The two-time Olympian, who was raised in South Australia's Happy Valley, returned to his home in San Diego at the start of the year for the recovery process after spending months in hospital in Colorado. Image: Facebook 
"He is doing physio four times per week and can now hold himself up on a stationary bike and with support can actually pedal as well which is great," Willoughby's father said in a statement on Monday. 
"Sam is working hard every day in his recovery and knowing he has so much support back here in Australia really keeps him going." Willoughby in Rio. Image: AAP 
The SA government revealed on Monday it will auction off a hot lap with racing driver Lee Holdsworth, who is in Adelaide for the Clipsal 500 event, to raise money to help Willoughby's recovery. 
Sport Minister Leon Bignell said there has been an outpouring of support for Willoughby from people across the state and the auction is a great opportunity for people wanting to aid his recovery. 
"South Australians were in a state of shock following Sam's injury and it's been great to see everyone really come together to help," he said. Close
